items.title: India’s GDP Expected to Grow 7.3% in Q2
items.excerpt: Government sources signal that India’s quarterly GDP may expand by 7.3% in Q2, driven by manufacturing output and steady services demand.

items.title: Sensex and Nifty Open Flat Amid Global Cues
items.excerpt: Indian benchmark indices started Tuesday’s session little changed as traders tracked mixed signals from Asian and US markets.

items.title: RBI Report Highlights Strong Investment Climate
items.excerpt: The Reserve Bank of India’s latest bulletin notes that private capital expenditure pipelines remain robust despite global uncertainty.

items.title: India’s Manufacturing Growth Slows in November
items.excerpt: Industry trackers say factory output moderated in November as export orders softened and firms worked through inventories.

items.title: India–Canada Trade Discussions Resume
items.excerpt: Negotiators from India and Canada met in New Delhi to restart talks on a trade agreement after a months-long pause.

items.title: Ayodhya Ram Mandir Inauguration Preparations Intensify
items.excerpt: Authorities in Ayodhya accelerated security, transport, and hospitality plans ahead of the Ram Mandir inauguration ceremony.

items.title: Tripura Marks 150 Years of ‘Vande Mataram’
items.excerpt: Tripura hosted cultural programs and youth parades to celebrate 150 years since ‘Vande Mataram’ was composed.

items.title: OnePlus 15 India Launch Expectations Grow
items.excerpt: Tech enthusiasts anticipate camera and battery upgrades as OnePlus readies its flagship 15 series for the Indian market.

items.title: Tulsi Vivah Celebrations Across India
items.excerpt: Devotees performed traditional rituals and community feasts to mark Tulsi Vivah, ushering in the winter wedding season.

items.title: India’s Digital Payments Hit Fresh Monthly Record
items.excerpt: UPI transactions crossed a new high in October as merchants in smaller towns embraced QR-based payments.

items.title: Global Climate Coalition Reaches Emissions Pact
items.excerpt: Leaders from 70 nations agreed on binding methane cuts and fresh climate finance benchmarks after marathon talks in Nairobi. Observers say the pact revives trust ahead of next year’s compliance window.

image.alt: Delegates signing a climate agreement

items.title: Digital ID Fast-Track Links Emerging Markets
items.excerpt: Finance ministers endorsed an interoperable ID rail to unlock cheaper remittances and portable health records. Pilot corridors covering 1.2 billion people will go live within six months.

image.alt: Screens showing secure digital identity tokens

items.title: Northern Corridor Summit Unlocks Infrastructure Funds
items.excerpt: East African states secured $18B for rail modernization and hybrid ports to ease commodity bottlenecks. The package ties disbursements to transparent procurement dashboards overseen by regional auditors.

image.alt: Freight corridor investment map

items.title: Asia-Pacific Ports Resume Ops After Typhoon Repairs
items.excerpt: Logistics groups restored 80% capacity by deploying modular power barges and flexible berths across Manila, Kaohsiung, and Osaka. Relief lanes now prioritize medical cargo and cold-chain food staples.

image.alt: Container cranes above teal waves

items.title: Global Food Security Fund Expands Emergency Stockpiles
items.excerpt: Donor blocs doubled rapid-response grain reserves and linked payouts to satellite drought triggers. Agencies expect the move to cut delivery times to high-risk regions by half.

image.alt: Stylized grain reserves illustration

items.title: Global Markets Rally as Tech Stocks Surge
items.excerpt: World markets experienced a strong upward surge today as major technology companies reported better-than-expected growth for Q4 2024.

image.alt: Traders analyze market data on digital displays
